Bonus Issue, Stock Split & Dividend:

Bajaj Finance announced a4:1 bonus issueand a1:2 stock split.

Record date for both corporate actions wasJune 16, 2025.

The company declared a total dividend ofRs. 56 per sharefor FY25.

This includes a special interim dividend of Rs. 12 (paid around May 26, 2025) and a final dividend of Rs. 44 (scheduled for disbursal around July 28, 2025).

RBI Notice on Co-branded Cards:

RBI issued a notice to Bajaj Finance regarding its co-branded credit cards.

Following this, Bajaj Finance ceased sourcing new co-branded cards with RBL Bank and DBS Bank.

Partnership with Airtel:

Bajaj Finance partnered with Bharti Airtel to offer financial products through the Airtel Thanks App.

This aimed to expand the reach of financial services to a broader customer base.

Financial Performance (FY25):

Assets Under Management (AUM) grew by26%to Rs 4,16,661 crore.

Customer base expanded by22%, reaching over 101.82 million.

Net Total Income (NTI) increased by24%to Rs 44,954 crore.

Profit After Tax (PAT) grew by over16%to Rs 16,779 crore.

The company delivered a Return on Average Assets (RoA) of4.57%and a Return on Average Equity (ROE) of19.19%.
